title: Why Roaming Supports will *Never* Work in Current Bot Lane Meta

replies.body:
You don't roam post-6 on Leona/Blitzcrank (or any other supports with CC)? 

(What's wrong with you?)

Pssht, I'm not saying don't roam away from ADC **ever**, but let me tell you, even when I go to ward I usually hear, "Shut Down".
{{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}
yeah you're supposed to position safely when your support roams... as in far back enough that you can't get engaged on.

> [{quoted}](name=Axel DC,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bKKpZEIo,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-03-07T01:02:34.095+0000)
>
> yeah you're supposed to position safely when your support roams... as in far back enough that you can't farm.

Fix'd

> [{quoted}](name=McAllister,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bKKpZEIo,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-03-07T01:05:54.530+0000)
>
> Fix'd

Petulent ADC main detected. 
Why should we babysit you? We belong to the team, not you. 

If you have 500+ range and still cant handle farming in a 1v2 lane, you have problems.

1. Top main, actually, but I've played ADC before.  More importantly, I've been zoned before.  Have you?
2. You belong to the team, and you help the team best by putting money in the ADC's bank account.  ADC doesn't stand for Attack Damage Champion, it's Attack Damage Carry.
3. If one of my lane opponents has 500+ range, the only safe place to farm is under the tower.  If one of my lane opponents is Blitz or Thresh, there is no safe place to farm.  Honestly, just think about it: if I'm the ADC in a 2v1 lane and I'm part of the 2, why would I ever not stand between my lone opponent and the minion wave?  I'm going to zone the crap out of them.
It's not about being babysat, it's that all supports I have that roam do it when the enemy can set up a pretty decent freeze. Leaving me and my baby Sivir range to just sit still and lose exp.
If your opponent lets you farm 2v1, they have problems... ADCs are important, which is why they have the support in the first place.
learn to cs under tower, it's an important skill

> [{quoted}](name=McAllister,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bKKpZEIo,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-03-07T01:05:54.530+0000)
>
> Fix'd

A lot of the times yeah you won't be able to farm or even be in xp range, but it's worth if your support gets a kill or a flash out of mid.

*Never* work is putting it a bit strongly, don't you think?  In a draft pick format, a roaming support could be counterpicked against a support that lacks hard engage.  Alternatively, if they buff Urgot like I hear they will, he might have what it takes to hold a lane that's 1v2 half the time.

But I agree, a traditional ADC going 1v2 or any 1v2 where the 2 includes Blitz seems like a recipe for sadness.
Maybe if people played ADCs who actually had the potential to hold their own, instead of spamming Jinx and Graves all day.
Urgot got a 5% mana scaling on his shield, they might be giving him some buffs to help him disengage as well.

You're right, never is pretty harsh! :p I also meant to imply that all of the supports who roam for mini-skirmishes on the enemy buffs with the allied JG would be losing the EXP that the Bard can just pick up with Chimes.

Wait, what? Watch some LCS. Roaming supports have been instrumental (pun intended) in setting up kills all over the map, consistently. Yes, they might not be the strongest things in solo queue, with a less competent ADC, but in team 5v5, they're very powerful.
YoloQ and LCS are 2 completely different things.. and YoloQ is what I'm referring to anyways. I should've made that more apparent somewhere, my bad.

in soloQ and low elo that may be, but with decent coordination, roaming supports are pretty strong, especially in a lane-swap scenario.
Roaming support is actually the current go-to in eu-lcs, hence that focus on annie.

I don't know why so many ADCs have trouble freezing the lane or farming under tower, and using their {{item:3340}} to avoid being ganked.

Further, a lot of ADCs have moves that allow them to farm from a distance (Caitlyn's Q... also her basic attacks, Varus's Q, Ashe's Volley, MF's Q or E)
A good enough support will get you fed early enough to the point where they can just roam after you drop the tower and leave you to collect double kills in your 2v1 lane.

They are already in the meta.

Leona currently roams a fuckton, as does Alistar, and blitzcrank, and thresh.... oh wait
{{champion:74}} bot anyone?

Bard doesn't need to leave lane for long at all. His chimes tend to spawn right next to lane anyway; in river and near the buff areas. He even gets movement speed so...I don't see what the problem is?

Thats why Bard doesn't roam all the time since his chimes last for 10 minutes. He isn't really as roaming as you would think, more of just that being how he powers up in the game. Its like farming your Q as Nasus. You are gonna do it, but majority of the time you will need to help the team.

By the way, I just naturally assumed the upcoming roaming support champion is who you were referring to.
Actually I've toyed around with the idea of a roaming support leona... like run mid and gank then go back bot. I've never actaully tried it but I mean it seems like a decent idea.
those aren't the most popular supports atm tho

> [{quoted}](name=Tang Bohu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bKKpZEIo,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-03-07T01:02:10.531+0000)
>
> those aren't the most popular supports atm tho

Braum isn't, but Leona and Blitz are.

Supports are supposed to support the *team,* not be a babysitter 24/7.

Yeah, when Bard comes out he'll go bot lane with you during the laning phase, but just like the jungler... *other lanes can use their help.*
